Today, the House passed a two-year extension of the Radiation Exposure Compensation Act (RECA). Below is my joint statement with @SenatorLujan https://t.co/MlzFDMnLFj

In 1945 the US exploded the first atomic bomb at the Trinity Site in NM. Over the next 48 years, the U.S. conducted more than 200 above-ground nuclear tests. As a result many communities around the test sites currently suffer from lung cancer, pulmonary fibrosis & other diseases.

Unfortunately, decades later, many New Mexicans continue to fall ill due to radiation exposure. This two-year extension of RECA is a step in the right direction to secure a long-term extension and expansion of benefits and eligibility, but we have more work to do.
